prompt: My new tank is cloudy after three days — what do I do?

inputs.context: set up 3 days ago; new filter; fed once

render.overview: Cloudiness in a new setup is usually a harmless bacterial bloom. Don’t panic; aim for stability.
likely_causes: Normal bacterial bloom during early cycling
fix_steps: Run filter continuously; point outlet at surface for oxygenation.
Avoid large water changes; if visibility is near zero, do 15% changes every 48h.
Test daily; only add livestock when ammonia and nitrite are both 0 for 3 consecutive days.
prevention: Feed very lightly during the first 1–2 weeks.
Rinse new substrate thoroughly before use.
Add hardy live plants to compete with excess nutrients.
render.footer: Questions or concerns? info@jamesdelong.com • Aquaria shares citations and includes non-sponsored alternatives for any product links.
